main event: A small black particle was observed followed by a bright ball of fire over the ocean on January 19, 1963.
interesting points: The sighting was conducted visually from a vessel belonging to Oregon State University., The object had a round shape and was described as a small black particle., The bright ball of fire was comparable in size to the initial object., The azimuth of the object's course was noted to be 010 degrees., The sighting occurred during a clear night before the object faded into the water.
sighted object: small black particle followed by a bright ball of fire
witness description: Captain Ben Gertulla, 50 years old, captain of the vessel
